New Records: Only Imran Nazir has hit more sixes than Fakhar Zaman for Pakistan in an ODI World Cup game.
Shaheen Shah Afridi became the joint-highest wicket-taker in the World Cup, with 16 wickets along with Adam Zampa.
Key Match Events: Pakistan won by 7 wickets with 105 balls remaining.
Fakhar Zaman hit 81 off 74 balls in his comeback game, smashing seven sixes and three fours.
Abdullah Shafique scored 68 off 69 balls with two sixes and nine fours.
Shaheen Shah Afridi and Haris Rauf provided early breakthroughs for Pakistan.
Mehidy Hasan Miraz took three wickets for Bangladesh.
Shaheen Shah Afridi took an important wicket in the middle overs.
Haris Rauf dismissed Shakib Al Hasan.
Mohammad Wasim ran through the Bangladesh tail, taking the last three wickets.
Pre-Game Insights: Shakib Al Hasan wins the toss and opts to bat, citing the pitch is dry.
Pakistan made three changes to their lineup, including Fakhar Zaman returning in place of Imam-ul-Haq.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan stay alive in the tournament, while Bangladesh are officially knocked out.
Fakhar Zaman and Abdullah Shafique laid the groundwork for a resounding Pakistan victory.
Pakistan have kept their hopes of a semi-finals spot alive with this seven-wicket victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan have now played seven matches at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata, and won six of them.
The Cricket Association of Bengal hosted over 500 children at the Eden Gardens for the match.
